result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colton B. Freeman

defendant.name: Freeman, Colton B.
defendant.address: N4577 Main Street Apt #2, Catawba, WI 54515

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:08 PM ADA Fuhr calls case and states appearances. Defendant Colton B. Freeman appeared by video, in custody from the Price County Jail.  Attorney Steven Daniel Johnson appeared by video for Colton B. Freeman.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Johnson gives status updates in the case and states they are working with the DA's office on a resolution. ADA Fuhr requests this matter be set for a motion hearing. Parties agree on 11/21/2022 at 2:30 PM as the date for the motion hearing.
Attorney Johnson's Office given Zoom information
Status hearing on October 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Colton B. Freeman
Current: N4577 Main Street Apt #2, Catawba, WI 54515 United States  (Effective: 08-12-2022)
Prior: W1530 Brantwood Avenue, Brantwood, WI 54513
Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.

8:31 AM ADA Fuhr calls case and states appearances. Defendant Colton B. Freeman appeared by video.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven Daniel Johnson appeared by video for Colton B. Freeman. Court questions defendant on remote appearance. Defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom for today's purpose. Court states a signed Waiver of Preliminary Hearing Form has been filed. Preliminary Hearing waived.  Waiver accepted by the Court. Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived. moves to arraignment. ADA Fuhr gives date of October 6, 2022 at 1:15 PM for a status hearing.. All parties agree to the date.
Waiver of Prelim on August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Waiver of Prelim on August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 10:03 AM Defendant Colton B. Freeman in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Bond already set and is to continue. So ordered. Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived. Defendant states he is waiting for appointment of counsel through SPD. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA

2:27 PM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant Colton Freeman appeared via video from Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE next court date is 6/21/22 at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Bond ordered as requested.
